title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate nominal GDP in 2020 as $120 million and/or does not show the work.

NGDP=$70 million+$25 million+$10 million+[ $20 million−$5 million ]             =$120 million MathType@MTEF@5@5@@7A10@

The response calculates nominal GDP in 2020 as $120 million and shows the work.

NGDP=$70 million+$25 million+$10 million+[ $20 million−$5 million ]             =$120 million MathType@MTEF@5@5@@7A10@

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate real GDP in 2020 as $80 million and/or does not show the work.

Real GDP= Nominal GDP GDP Deflator ×100= $120 million 150 ×100=$80 million MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6EC0@

The response calculates real GDP in 2020 as $80 million and shows the work.

Real GDP= Nominal GDP GDP Deflator ×100= $120 million 150 ×100=$80 million MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6EC0@

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not explain that, for a given year, nominal GDP measures the value of output at current market prices whereas real GDP measures the value of output at base-year (constant) prices.
The response explains that, for a given year, nominal GDP measures the value of output at current market prices whereas real GDP measures the value of output at base-year (constant) prices.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Liang Island did not experience economic growth in per capita terms in 2020 and/or does not explain that real GDP per capita in 2019 was $24 and real GDP per capita in 2020 was $16 (or does not explain that real GDP in 2019 was $120 million and real GDP in 2020 was $80 million and the population did not change).

The response states that Liang Island did not experience economic growth in per capita terms in 2020 and explains that real GDP per capita in 2019 was $24 and real GDP per capita in 2020 was $16 (or explains that real GDP in 2019 was $120 million and real GDP in 2020 was $80 million and the population did not change).

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify a fiscal policy that would promote economic growth such as increased spending on education, increased spending on infrastructure, granting business tax credits, or reducing taxes on savings and capital gains, and/or does not explain how that specific fiscal policy action will increase economic growth through an increase in physical capital, human capital, technology, research and development, and/or productivity.

The response identifies a fiscal policy that would promote economic growth such as increased spending on education, increased spending on infrastructure, granting business tax credits, or reducing taxes on savings and capital gains, and appropriately explains how that specific fiscal policy action will increase economic growth through an increase in physical capital, human capital, technology, research and development, and/or productivity.
